name: Cup Plant
climate: Cup Plants thrive in temperate climates, often found in prairies.
They prefer regions with moderate rainfall and warm summers.
The ideal climate includes distinct seasonal changes year-round.
Adaptable to various climates, from cold to subtropical regions.
sunlight: Cup Plants require full sun exposure to grow optimally.
They can tolerate partial shade but may not flower as well.
At least 6 hours of direct sunlight daily is recommended.
Optimal sunlight conditions promote vigorous growth and blooms.
watering: Water regularly to keep the soil consistently moist but not soggy.
During dry spells, increase watering frequency to maintain hydration.
They tolerate short periods of drought once established properly.
Avoid letting the soil dry out completely for prolonged periods.
soil: Cup Plants prefer well-draining soil rich in organic matter.
They can grow in a variety of soil types, including clay and loam.
Amending the soil with compost improves growth and flowering.
Ensure good drainage to prevent waterlogging and root rot.
extra_care_tip: Deadheading spent flowers can encourage continuous blooming.
Divide plants every few years to maintain vigor and control spread.
